intro: Campylia blattaria, commonly known as the flatleaf fern, is a rare and delicate plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Polypodiaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage. The plant features broad, leathery leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat needs, Campylia blattaria is considered a rare and endangered species.
